010package imagingbook.lib.util;
011
012import java.io.File;
013import java.io.FileOutputStream;
014import java.io.IOException;
015import java.io.InputStream;
016import java.net.URI;
017import java.net.URISyntaxException;
018import java.net.URL;
019import java.net.URLClassLoader;
020import java.nio.file.Path;
021import java.util.jar.Manifest;
022
023import javax.swing.JFileChooser;
024import javax.swing.LookAndFeel;
025import javax.swing.UIManager;
026
027import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
028
029
030/**
031 * This class defines various static methods for managing
032 * file-based resources and JAR manifest files.
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 */
036public abstract class FileUtils {
037
038        /**
039         * Removes the extension part of a pathname.
040         * Examples:<br>
041         * "foo.txt" &rarr; "foo",
042         * "foo" &rarr; "foo",
043         * "foo." &rarr; "foo.",
044         * ".txt" &rarr; ".txt".
045         * @param name the pathname
046         * @return the pathname without the extension (if valid)
047         */
048        public static String stripFileExtension(String name) {
049                int dotInd = name.lastIndexOf('.');
050                // if dot is in the first position,
051                // we are dealing with a hidden file rather than an DefaultFileExtension
052                return (dotInd > 0) ? name.substring(0, dotInd) : name;
053        }
054        
055        /**
056         * Extracts the extension part of a pathname as a string.
057         * Examples:<br>
058         * "foo.txt" &rarr; "txt",
059         * "foo" &rarr; "",
060         * "foo." &rarr; "",
061         * ".txt" &rarr; "".
062         * @param name the pathname
063         * @return the extension or an empty string
064         */
065        public static String getFileExtension(String name) {
066                int dotInd = name.lastIndexOf('.');
067                return (dotInd > 0) ? name.substring(dotInd + 1) : "";
068        }
069        
070        // ----  resources-related stuff ----------------------------------
071        
072        /**
073         * Find the path from which a given class was loaded.
074         * @param clazz a class.
075         * @return the path of the .class file for the given class or null (e.g.
076         * if the class is anonymous).
077         */
078        public static String getClassPath(Class<?> clazz) {
079                String path = null;
080                try {
081                        URI uri = clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toURI();
082                        if (uri != null && !uri.getPath().isEmpty()) {
083                                path = new File(uri).getCanonicalPath();
084                        }
085                } catch (URISyntaxException | IOException e) { }
086                return path;
087        }
088        
089//      public static String getClassPath(Class<?> clazz) {
090//              return clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().getFile();
091//              //return clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toString();
092//      }
093        
094        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
095
096        /**
097         * Lists (to System.out) the paths where classes are loaded from.
098         */
099        public static void printClassPath() {
100                ClassLoader cl = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();
101                URL[] urls = ((URLClassLoader) cl).getURLs();
102                for (URL url : urls) {
103                        System.out.println(url.getPath());
104                }
105        }
106        
107        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
108        
109        /**
110         * Checks 'by name' if a particular class exists.
111         * 
112         * @param classname fully qualified name of the class, e.g. {@literal imagingbook.lib.util.FileUtils}
113         * @return {@code true} if the class was found, {@code false} otherwise
114         */
115        public static boolean checkClass(String classname) {
116                // String logStr = "  checking class " + classname + " ... ";
117                try {
118                        if (Class.forName(classname) != null) {
119                                // IJ.log(logStr + "OK");
120                                return true;
121                        }
122                } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) { }
123                // IJ.log(logStr + "ERROR");
124                return false;
125        }
126        
127        
128        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
129        
130        // from https://bukkit.org/threads/extracting-file-from-jar.16962/
131        /**
132         * Reads all data from the given input stream and copies them
133         * to to a file.
134         * @param in the input stream
135         * @param file the output file
136         * @throws IOException if anything goes wrong
137         */
138        public static void copyToFile(InputStream in, File file) throws IOException {
139                FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(file);
140                try {
141                        byte[] buf = new byte[1024];
142                        int i = 0;
143                        while ((i = in.read(buf)) != -1) {
144                                out.write(buf, 0, i);
145                        }
146                } catch (IOException e) {
147                        throw e;
148                } finally {
149                        if (in != null) {
150                                in.close();
151                        }
152                        if (out != null) {
153                                out.close();
154                        }
155                }
156        }
157        
158        
159        
160        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
161        
162        /**
163         * Finds the manifest (from META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) of the JAR file
164         * from which {@literal clazz} was loaded.
165         * 
166         * See: http://stackoverflow.com/a/1273432
167         * @param clazz A class in the JAR file of interest.
168         * @return A {@link Manifest} object or {@literal null} if {@literal clazz}
169         * was not loaded from a JAR file.
170         */
171        public static Manifest getJarManifest(Class<?> clazz) {
172                String className = clazz.getSimpleName() + ".class";            
173                String classPath = clazz.getResource(className).toString();
174                //IJ.log("classPath = " + classPath);
175                if (!classPath.startsWith("jar")) { // Class not from JAR
176                  return null;
177                }
178                String manifestPath = classPath.substring(0, classPath.lastIndexOf("!") + 1) + "/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF";
179                Manifest manifest = null;
180                try {
181                        manifest = new Manifest(new URL(manifestPath).openStream());
182                } catch (IOException ignore) { }
183                return manifest;
184        }
185        
186        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
187        
188        
189        /**
190         * Opens a dialog for the user to select a single folder (no files).
191         * Contained files and sub-folders are shown.
192         * Uses native (system) look-and-feel; original look-and-feel is restored.
193         * 
194         * @param startDirectory the directory to start from (pass {@code ""} or {@code "."} for the current directory)
195         * @param dialogTitle the string shown in the title bar of the dialog window
196         * @return a {@link File} object representing the selected directory or {@code null} if the dialog was canceled 
197         */
198        public static File selectFolder(String startDirectory, String dialogTitle) {
199                File startDir = new File(startDirectory);
200                if (!startDir.exists()) {
201                        startDir = new File(".");
202                }
203                
204                JFileChooser chooser = null;
205                LookAndFeel laf = UIManager.getLookAndFeel();   // get current look-and-feel
206
207                try { 
208                        UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName()); // use native look and feel
209                        chooser = new JFileChooser(startDir) {
210                                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
211                                public void approveSelection() {
212                                        if (getSelectedFile().isFile()) {
213                                                return;
214                                        } else {
215                                                super.approveSelection();
216                                        }
217                                } 
218                        };
219                        UIManager.setLookAndFeel(laf);  // reset look-and-feel
220                } 
221                catch (Exception e) { }
222                
223                if (chooser == null)
224                        return null;
225                
226                chooser.setDialogTitle(dialogTitle);
227                chooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.FILES_AND_DIRECTORIES);
228                chooser.setAcceptAllFileFilterUsed(true);
229                chooser.setMultiSelectionEnabled(false);
230                chooser.setSelectedFile(new File(".")); // see https://stackoverflow.com/a/48316113
231
232                if (chooser.showOpenDialog(null) == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
233                        File selected = chooser.getSelectedFile();
234                        if (selected == null)
235                                throw new RuntimeException("selected directory is null");
236                        return selected;
237                }
238                else {  // dialog was canceled
239                        return null;
240                }
241        }
242        
243        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
244        
245        private static final String DirectoryKey = "imagingbook#dir";
246        private static String DefaultUserDirectory = System.getProperty("user.dir");
247        
248        /**
249         * Sets a system property to memorize the current directory.
250         * Use {@link #getCurrentDirectory()} to retrieve this value.
251         * If the specified pathname is not a directory (i.e., a plain file), 
252         * its parent directory is used.
253         * 
254         * @param pathname a directory of file path
255         */
256        @Deprecated  // use setCurrentDirectory(Class, String) instead
257        public static void setCurrentDirectory(String pathname) {
258                File file = new File(pathname);
259                String dir = (file.isDirectory()) ? file.toString() : file.getParent();
260                System.setProperty(DirectoryKey, dir);
261        }
262        
263        /**
264         * Associates a current directory with the specified class by
265         * setting a system property to make this persistent through class reloads.
266         * Use {@link #getCurrentDirectory(Class)} to retrieve this value.
267         * If the specified pathname is not a directory (i.e., a plain file), 
268         * its parent directory is used.
269         * 
270         * @param clazz the class to associate the directory with
271         * @param pathname a directory of file path
272         */
273        public static void setCurrentDirectory(Class<?> clazz, String pathname) {
274                File file = new File(pathname);
275                String dir = (file.isDirectory()) ? file.toString() : file.getParent();
276                System.setProperty(makeDirectoryKey(clazz), dir);
277        }
278        
279        public static void setCurrentDirectory(Class<?> clazz, Path path) {
280                File file = path.toFile();
281                String dir = (file.isDirectory()) ? file.toString() : file.getParent();
282                System.setProperty(makeDirectoryKey(clazz), dir);
283        }
284        
285        /**
286         * Returns the current directory path. 
287         * If the directory was set with {@link #setCurrentDirectory(String)} before
288         * this path is returned,
289         * otherwise the value for the "user.dir" system property.
290         * 
291         * @return a string with the current directory path
292         */
293        @Deprecated  // use getCurrentDirectory(Class) instead
294        public static String getCurrentDirectory() {
295                String dir = System.getProperty(DirectoryKey);
296                return (dir != null) ? dir : DefaultUserDirectory;
297        }
298        
299        
300        /**
301         * Returns the current directory associated with the specified class. 
302         * (usually of type {@code PlugIn} or {@code PlugInFilter}).
303         * If the directory was set with {@link #setCurrentDirectory(Class,String)} before
304         * this path is returned, {@code null} otherwise.
305         * 
306         * @param clazz the class to associate the directory with
307         * @return a string with the current directory path or null if not registered
308         */
309        public static String getCurrentDirectory(Class<?> clazz) {
310                return System.getProperty(makeDirectoryKey(clazz));
311        }
312        
313        private static String makeDirectoryKey(Class<?> clazz) {
314                return DirectoryKey + "#" + clazz.getCanonicalName();
315        }
316        
317        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
318                        
319        public static void main(String[] args) {
320//              String fileName = ".txt";
321//              System.out.println("name = " + fileName);
322//              System.out.println("stripped = " + stripFileExtension(fileName));
323//              System.out.println("ext = " + getFileExtension(fileName));
324//              System.out.println(getClassPath(FileUtils.class));
325                
326                System.out.println("dir = " + getCurrentDirectory());
327                setCurrentDirectory("C:/tmp");
328                System.out.println("dir = " + getCurrentDirectory());
329                setCurrentDirectory("D:/tmp");
330                System.out.println("dir = " + getCurrentDirectory());
331        }
